newsitem.title: USA: U.S. to urge extension on EU import standards.
newsitem.headline: U.S. to urge extension on EU import standards.

text.p: U.S. trade negotiators will ask the European Union to extend its January 1 deadline for implementing a food safety import directive if there is no progress in talks, an Agriculture Department official said Thursday.

"If we get much closer to the deadline and we get no closer (to an agreement), we'll strongly urge them to postpone it further," USDA Food Safety and Inspection Service associate administrator Thomas Billy said.

Billy, who was speaking at a meeting of broiler producers outside Washington, was replying to a question on ongoing talks on implementation of the EU's so-called third-country directive on food safety.

He said the EU had been "virtually unresponsive" to a U.S. document submitted earlier this year outlining what steps EU members would have to take to enter into a mutual recognition agreement with the United States. The mutual agreement was requested by the EU, he said.
